transportAdvice: Phuket lacks a formal metro or tram system, and walking between attractions is generally impractical due to distances and heat; shared minibuses (songthaews) run fixed routes along major roads and are affordable but infrequent. Metered taxis, tuk-tuks, and motorbike taxis are widely available throughout tourist areas, though negotiating fares in advance is common practice.

Deep into monsoon season with persistent rain and strong winds; lower tourist crowds and reduced prices.
Continued heavy rainfall and choppy seas; outdoor plans should be flexible and boat trips may be limited.
Still firmly in the wet season with regular downpours, though sunny breaks between showers are common.
One of the wettest months of the year with high surf warnings frequent; a quieter period for tourism.
Rain remains heavy and seas can be rough; the tail end of monsoon season with gradual improvement late in the month.
The monsoon begins to ease and conditions improve noticeably, though showers are still possible.
Dry season returns with calmer seas and sunny skies; the start of high season and holiday crowds.
